Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: albenea
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in a triple room, the room was quite spacious and well equipped. The hotel has a lift which is not necessary available in all hotels of this range i Venice. The lift is small, but we enjoyed taking the narrow but very nice stairs. The breakfast is very good. The location is very good either you want to walk or even if you want to take the water public transport. Venice is amazing and this hotel is a very good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “not very impressed”
Reviews.Author: kagee16
Reviews.Content: We needed one night's accommodation at the end of our honeymoon in Venice. This hotel had come recommended as second on a list from a friend. The first hotel was fully booked, we checked it out two days before and they couldn't show us a room then. We decided that at 210 euros, we should just take it. Overall, it was ok, but it was still really hot in Venice in the middle of September and the aircon in the room would not go below 20 degrees celcius, which is not cooling at all. We asked reception to look at it during the day we checked in. They did, and left a note in the room saying they were sorry, but it wouldn't go any lower. That evening we asked the reception desk again and they said, why didnt you ask during the day when the maintenance person is here. I said that we had. At 10pm I called the front desk to tell them that it was unbearably hot, and did they have a fan or a ventilator that we could use. The front desk man said that the Italian Government had declared that since it was September, it was no longer summer and that they were not allowed to lower the airconditioning temperature. I had never heard such rubbish in my life, but how do you argue that at 10pm at night over the phone. So we had to sleep with wet towels over our bodies all night, which only helped a little. After a bad night sleep, we awoke to find we had been bitten by mosquitos. Front desk claimed that they could have offered us an anti-mosquito coil, but we already had plugged one in the room. Problem was that we couldn't use it all night coz there was only one working plug socket in the room which we needed to charge our camera battery with. But breakfast was nice and the place was generally very clean. Had good internet connection which we paid for separately for each device. In the morning we discovered that we only needed to pay for the 6 hour internet access as it lasted as long as the 12 hour access code. Oh well, it was on a couple of euros. Location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “best value,location and staff”
Reviews.Author: gabriella l
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice without having made a reservation. We saw this hotel and enquired if there was a vacancy.We were shown a couple of rooms and decided on a lovely room overlooking the garden restaurant.. The room was comfortable, clean and airconditioned. The complimentary mini bar was a lovely surprise. The staff were efficient and attentive. The breakfast items on offer were generous and fresh.After paying an average of 7 euro for a coffee in Venice-it was welcoming to see espresso coffee served at breakfast (included in the room price). We met a couple in a cafe at St Marko's square and they told us that they could not find a room, we suggested this hotel. It was lovely to see them at breakfast the next day and even lovelier to find that they too were happy with the hotel. We would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: ACMan53
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommeded to us by my 88 year old aunt (I was skeptical). We loved the hotel and Venice more than we thought. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The breakfast was more than satisfactory...the hotel was close to all the main areas without being noisy. The room was small but very comfortable...a little pricey, but then again what isn't in Europe nowadays. It's an old hotel, but what isn't in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service but five star prices for a dated offer”
Reviews.Author: Stuart53
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location on Dorsaduro close to the Accademia. The reception staff are friendly and experienced. The hotel is on four floors with a small 2 person lift for those unable to manage the stairs. Rooms are compact, but homely and with some nice framed posters and terrazo flooring add local character. The room we used had a tiny and rather antiquated bathroom complete with a four foot bath with a shower fitment sitting in the tub. Breakfast was surprisingly basic for the price and fruit and other bowls on the buffet were emptied they remained that way. Breakfast coffee tasted as if it was instant. I understand this has been a popular hotel for a number of years, but it seems to be lagging a bit behind the competition.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but tired hotel with little to offer”
Reviews.Author: kona_kids_ofthebay
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet location away from major crowds. Near Accademia Bridge, water taxi, restaurants, internet cafe et al. Bathroom and sheets were clean. We would not recommend this hotel however due to lack of service, old,saggy furniture, bed coverings, tired rooms and overall poor attitude of proprietor (would not print boarding passes for flight.) The weather was sunny and a bit warm (room was on second floor) & so my husband was hoping to cool the room. He asked about air cond. and her response was " why just open the window and enjoy the air." We opened the window that evening and were kept up due to noise from the hotel restaurant, the street noise below as well as lots of mosquitoes. We have traveled to europe many times and have been in Venice in the past. The experience was disappointing and made us ready to leave Venice.

Reviews.Title: “poor value”
Reviews.Author: Duncan072
Reviews.Content: Despite the great location this was expensive and poor value for money. Our double bed took most of the room space which was well worn. The breakfast was self service and with little choice and tiny quantities in a scruffy and badly cleaned dining room area. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent situation, excellent facilities - look no further”
Reviews.Author: Lorie22
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Venice in different areas over many years, finally we found the perfectly placed, well priced small hotel with excellent facilities and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: RKDW
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly, helpful, and the food was excellent. ---some of the best that I have ever eaten anywhere in the world. Room had a small balcony and it was quiet and relaxing. I never reccomend BUT I have suggested this hotel to any of my friends who are going to Venice. I will definately stay there the next time I go to Venice

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Venice hotel”
Reviews.Author: euromerp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Agli Alboretti for 2 nights while in Venice and I loved this little hotel. The staff was extremely welcoming and friendly, especially Anna, the owner. My room was very large for one person and it came with some nice extras - including a free minibar and complimentary slippers! I absolutely loved the location - just steps away from the Accademia bridge and vaporetto stop. The neighborhood is very cute and very quiet but it took no time at all to get to Piazza San Marco, where all the action is. There is a nice pizza cafe just down the block and other cute restaurants and gelato places nearby. The only criticism I would have is that the walls are very thin so you need to be careful about having your TV too loud, etc. But that is very normal for a european hotel. On my last day in Venice, I was catching the night train to Paris at 8pm. The hotel was completely okay with me leaving my bags there for the entire day and they were cool with me stopping back a couple of times to use their restroom facilities. I really loved this hotel and can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The restuarant”
Reviews.Author: FoodiefromLondon
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit in about 5 years - as before , we found the service friendly, the food excellent and very good value. This time we had the tasting menus at lunch on Easter Sunday - one fish and the other meat. In each case we had 4 courses plus two glasses of wine - and the bill was just a flat E60 for 2.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: Samcat1
Reviews.Content: Small hotel with helpful staff. Standard single room, clean. Breakfast usual fare. Would definitely stay there again. Excellent location in Accademia -- quiet. Two vaporetto stop options. Turn left out of the hotel door and away from the Grand Canal; you'll find quiet streets with some small shops, supermarket and several restaurants, and an expansive water view. If you want to take a long walk, you can do so without encountering hoardes of people. Great option to the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Venice”
Reviews.Author: tdlitt
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in Venice in September, 2006 at the Agli Alboretti and loved it. The hotel is located about one hundred yards from the Accademia bridge in the Dorsoduro district. ( It actually faces the side wall of the museum.) This gives you the best of both worlds. The Dorsoduro is directly across the Grand Canal from San Marco and is less "touristy" than San Marco. However, the Accademia bridge allows direct access to the sights (and crowds) across the Grand Canal. The hotel itself was fairly typical of small European hotels with rooms of varying sizes and shapes. The interior was clean, but could use some "freshening". Breakfast was good and the staff very helpful and friendly. I would stay at the Agli again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, away from St Marks frenzy”
Reviews.Author: Travelator2
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location in Dorsoduro, away from the frenzy around St Marks, but in a good location (right next to the Accademia) for sightseeing. Our room was on the first floor overlooking the street, but was quiet at night. The room was rather small, but comfortable. The included Breakfast was a bit mean: 1 roll, 1 croissant and coffee: for the price they could maybe be a bit more generous, but then Venice is an expensive place to stay. Hence the neutral/average rating, but really this is an OK place. The airport vaporetto drops you at Zattere, just at the bottom of the street, and in the other direction you have the Accademia vaporetto stop, so getting round is easy. For example, for a more ambitious trip, take 41/42 to Murano, then the LN line from the Murano Faro stop to Burano (v colourful island), then return to Venice San Zaccaria on the northern loop of the LN line via Lido. We ate at Tavervno San Trovaso just round the corner from the hotel on Fondamenta Priuli and the associated Restaurant San Trovaso nearby at the bottom of Rio Terra Carita: both good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LostHome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel this fall and had a wonderful visit to Venice. The staff was ok- not rude and not particularly friendly either. The room was ok. The restaurant was good and the bed was awful. The best thing about this hotel is the location. On our next visit, we'll probably stay somewhere else, but really, not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location Agli alboretti”
Reviews.Author: lollaa
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a stay at the Agli Alboretti in Venice. V. good location and v. easy to find. Rooms a good size and clean. Only gripe is on their website they say they have air con but don't. Which was ok for now but not in the height of summer. Staff v. friendly and helpful. All in all a very good reasonable price hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A party of 3 stayed at the hotel March 14 & 15 2004. We came in early on boat and the hotel did not open until 7am. They were very accomadating and although our room was not ready invited us to their breakfast and upgraded our room at no cost. The room was adequate in size for 3 women, the bathroom was very small and no shower only a small tub with a handheld shower. They were very friendly and great location to the canal and into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Agli Alboretti - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found several references to the Alboretti online and in travel magazines that I subscribe to (Conde Nast, for example), so my wife and I booked a room here for a week. What follows is pretty much a stream of consciousness brain-dump...I'm making no attempt to organize my thoughts :) The hotel includes a restaurant, "bar", and two "lounge" areas (One right off the restaurant which I think doubles as the bar, and one on the 2nd floor which acts more as a library). Common areas were small, but well maintained -- as was our room, #118. This room faced out onto a small courtyard and had an unexceptional view. From what I read elsewhere, all rooms are about the same size and of the same quality except for #119, which is extremely dark and should be avoided. Service at the hotel was good -- the staff was friendly and most spoke some English. During our stay my wife managed to catch a 48-hour stomach flu of some sort, and the front desk was able to get a doctor for us on short notice. Also, on our last day, we encountered Venice's well-known "Aqua Alta": Water was up to right below the knee on the streets, and the hotel's lobby and restaurant had 3-4 inches of water in them. The hotel served everyone breakfast in their rooms and lent us Wellies so we could (try to) stay dry while getting our bags out to a waiting water taxi. In my opinion, the Alboretti's location and relatively low price (for Venice anyway -- 130 Euros/night), were its main selling points. While a stone's throw away from the Accademia, the area around the hotel didn't seem overrun by tourists like us. There were two relatively inexpensive trattorias nearby and an Internet cafe just over the Accademia Bridge in Campo San Stefano. You'll find a Vaparetto stop right in front of the Accademia for the days you don't feel like walking to where you need to go. You can walk 5 minutes west, and you'll find yourself in what appeared to be as much of a "local" area of town as you can get, populated by students. So to sum things up -- Room - Average: Small, but clean. Service - Good: Helpful, if not a touch disorganized...but what do you expect in Italia? Location - Superb: Convenient but not too busy Value - Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly Alboretti”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This small hotel, is very quaintly tucked in behind the Accadamia bridge and so is very convenient for the vaporetto and within hopping distance from the Guggenheim. At Â€145 a night it was averagely priced for Venice but it was still overpriced for the room we got, during a weekend in August this year. It was very very small and smelled a bit peculiar! The bathroom was like a public cubicle in size and was decorated like one too. We had a small little balcony overlooking the back of the hotel which was pleasant to sit out on but not enough to recommend a return visit. One of the main reasons we booked Agli Alboretti was because of the reviews about its apparently lovely restaurant - unfortunately we never got to try it as it is closed for the month of August.... Overall I have enjoyed better and cheaper hotels in Venice in the past and would urge readers to look elsewhere.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Agli Alboretti
HotelInfo.Address: Accademia 884 | Dorsoduro, 30123 Venice, Italy
